ul_87183: How to create a formatted partition image file from scratch?
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_87183: truncate -s64M file # no need to fill it with zeros, just make it sparse
fdisk file # create partitions
losetup /dev/loop0 file
mkfs.vfat /dev/loop0p1 # for the first partition.
mount /dev/loop0p1 /mnt/

Top-3 Similar Questions: su_546842: Creating a movie from pdf images
so_5187560: Create image from file, containing all points (imagemagick)
Top-3 Scripts:
su_546842: for i in {2..9087}
do 
   sips -z 1024 -s format png fig${i}.pdf --out png/fig${i}.png
   convert png/fig${i}.png -background=white -flatten +matte aa.png && 
   mv aa.png png/fig${i}.png
done
